title: Enamtila
description: The temple of the god Bēl-mātāti (Enlil), Enamtila (“House of Life”), was located in the Kumar district of Babylon, in the western half of the inner city. According to the Babylonian topographical text Tintir = Babylon Tablet IV, it was one of seven temples in that part of Babylon. Enamtila is mentioned in Old Babylonian and Kassite Period texts.

properties.description: The proposed location of Enamtila is based on George 1992: 24 fig. 4, as well as a plan of the ruins of Babylon, with 500 m UTM coordinates.
properties.title: Proposed location of Enamtila
